Global Exception Handler:
The Global Exception Handler is a type of workflow designed to determine the project’s behavior when encountering an execution error. Only one Global Exception Handler can be added per automation project.

Note that the Global Exception Handler is not available for library projects, only processes.
Use the ActivityInfo property for errorInfo to get the name of the activity which threw the exception and view it in the Output panel.

The Global Exception Handler has two arguments, that should not be removed.

The first argument is errorInfo with the In direction and it stores information about the error that was thrown and the workflow that failed. The level of the error to be logged can be set in the Log Message activity.

Please note that any workflow may be flagged as a Global Exception Handler in Studio, except for library projects.

The second argument, result has the Out direction and it is used for determining the next behavior of the process when it encounters an error. The following values can be assigned to the result argument:
When an error is encountered, the execution runs the Global Exception Handler and re-throws the error.
The execution runs the Global Handler, ignores the error, and continues from the next activity after the one which threw the exception.
The execution runs the Global Handler and attempts to retry executing the activity which threw the error. Use the RetryCount method for errorInfo to count the number of times the activity is retried.
The execution stops upon encountering the error and the Global Handler doesn't step in.

It keeps the workflow in the pause state, allowing you to inspect each activity and the variables or arguments in the Locals panel.
